intro: Tibouchina dimorphylla, commonly known as the purpleleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, which bloom in late winter to early spring. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive leaves and long-lasting blooms. Tibouchina dimorphylla thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
